response.reasoning: The phrase 'any of the other selected units' is grammatically correct and idiomatic.
The UK English spelling for the past tense of 'fuel' is 'fuelled', not 'fueled'.
While 'outside' is generally preferred in formal UK English, 'outside of' is not grammatically incorrect, though it can be considered less concise.
'Colored' is part of the official and historical name of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) and should not be altered.
The apostrophe should not be used when referring to a decade as a plural (e.g., 1920s).
'The Roaring 20's' is presented as the title of a video resource, and titles should be reproduced exactly as they appear.
The word 'Definition' is incorrectly split as 'Definiti on', indicating a parsing error.
'Post-war' should be hyphenated when used as a compound adjective modifying 'restoration'.
'Ill-treatment' should be hyphenated as a compound noun in this context.
'Organization' is part of the official and historical name of the National Organization for Women (NOW) and should not be altered.
